summary: This document is an email chain from July 25, 2019, forwarding a notification about an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The forwarded report, dated July 24, 2019, states that Epstein was found in his cell with a noose around his neck and was placed on suicide watch. The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the document; found in his cell with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch at MCC New York.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: Reported the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein to the Bureau of Prisons and provided details about his condition and status.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.role: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient or sender of the notification regarding the incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and status following the incident in his cell.
The Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal was notified of the incident involving Epstein at the correctional facility.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, assessed by medical staff, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cell Mate Threat Report
events.description: Epstein's cell mate reported being threatened to be killed, though no further details were provided in the notification.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of July 24, 2019, with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch and later downgraded to suicide observation following medical assessment.
Epstein's cell mate reported being threatened to be killed, though no further information was provided.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
The notification was forwarded via email on July 25, 2019, indicating internal communication about the incident.
